i1.name: Echoing Flames
description: {{sbc|Innate:}} '''Urgot's''' six legs each conceal a shotgun that covers an arc, together forming a full circle of cover around him. Each shotgun has one shell and an individual reload timer.

'''Urgot's''' next [[basic attack]] {{tip|on-hit}} in the direction and range of a ''loaded'' shotgun causes it to fire, instantly dealing {{as|{{pp|key=%|40 to 100 for 6|1;6;9;11;13;15}} AD}} {{as|(+ {{pp|changedisplay=true|key=%|2 to 6 for 5|1;6;9;11;13}} of target's '''maximum''' health)}} {{as|physical damage}} to enemies in a cone, capped at {{pp|100 to 360}} against {{tip|monster|monsters}}.
i1.descriptionHtml:
Innate: Urgot's six legs each conceal a shotgun that covers an arc, together forming a full circle of cover around him. Each shotgun has one shell and an individual reload timer.
Urgot's next basic attack on-hit in the direction and range of a loaded shotgun causes it to fire, instantly dealing 1;6;9;11;13;15 ‒ undefined AD (+ 1;6;9;11;13 ‒ undefined of target's maximum health) physical damage to enemies in a cone, capped at 100undefined − 360undefined (based on level) against monsters.
i1.notes:
* ''Echoing Flames'':
** Will not trigger if the target is too far away or they are dead when the basic attack hits.
** Will not trigger while {{tip|Blind|blinded}} or if the basic attack is blocked by {{ai|Wind Wall|Yasuo}} or {{ai|Blade Whirl|Samira}}.
*** It bypasses {{tip|block|blocking}} and {{tip|dodge|dodging}} effects.
** Will not trigger versus {{tip|ward|wards}} nor [[jungle plants]].
** Will trigger from {{iis|Runaan's Hurricane}} additional bolts.
** Will not apply {{stil|life steal}}, but does apply on {{stil|spell vamp}} and [[omnivamp]] at 33% effectiveness.
** Will apply [[spell effect]]s.
** Will not trigger when basic attacking certain units (e.g {{cai|Jack in the Box|Shaco}}), however it will trigger when attacking them with {{ai|Purge|Urgot}}.
* '''Urgot's''' legs never change in orientation, with his body instead rotating on top of them; the leg that faces northeast will always face northeast. This does not affect '''Urgot's''' facing direction for the purposes of abilities such as {{ai|Petrifying Gaze|Cassiopeia}}.

q1.name: Corrosive Charge
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Urgot''' launches a canister at the target location that explodes {{fd|0.3}} seconds after it lands, dealing {{as|physical damage}} to all enemies within the area and {{tip|slow|slowing}} them for {{fd|1.25}} seconds.
q1.descriptionHtml: Active: Urgot launches a canister at the target location that explodes 0.3 seconds after it lands, dealing physical damage to all enemies within the area and slowing them for 1.25 seconds.
q1.notes: * ''Corrosive Charge'' prevents {{ai|Purge|Urgot}} from firing for {{fd|0.3}} seconds.

effects.str:
• Physical Damage: (+ 70% AD)

  • Slow: %

w1.name: Purge
description: {{sbc|Passive:}} '''Urgot's''' other abilities ''mark'' enemy champions for 5 seconds. Only one enemy champion can be ''marked'' at a time.

{{sbc|Active:}} For 4 seconds, '''Urgot''' grants {{tip|ghosting}} to non-champions and non-epic monsters around him and autonomously attacks the nearest enemy at a '''fixed''' {{sti|attack speed|{{as|{{fd|3.0}} attack speed}}}}, prioritizing ''marked'' enemy {{tip|champions}}, refreshing the ''mark'' with every attack. '''Urgot''' can attack while moving, but while firing, his {{as|'''base''' movement speed}} is reduced by {{as|125|ms}} and he gains 40% {{tip|slow resist}}. ''Purge'' can be recast after {{fd|0.5}} seconds for its duration, and does so automatically when its duration ends.

Attacks with ''Purge'' deal modified {{as|physical damage}}, with a minimum threshold of 50 against {{tip|monster|monsters}} and {{tip|minions}}. {{tip|On-hit}} damage is applied at 50% effectiveness and the attacks cannot {{tip|critically strike}}.
At maximum rank, ''Purge'' lasts indefinitely and becomes a toggled ability.
w1.descriptionHtml:
Passive: Urgot's other abilities mark enemy champions for 5 seconds. Only one enemy champion can be marked at a time.
Active: For 4 seconds, Urgot grants ghosting to non-champions and non-epic monsters around him and autonomously attacks the nearest enemy at a fixed 3.0 attack speed, prioritizing marked enemy champions, refreshing the mark with every attack. Urgot can attack while moving, but while firing, his base movement speed is reduced by 125 and he gains 40% slow resist. Purge can be recast after 0.5 seconds for its duration, and does so automatically when its duration ends.
Attacks with Purge deal modified physical damage, with a minimum threshold of 50 against monsters and minions. On-hit damage is applied at 50% effectiveness and the attacks cannot critically strike.
Recast: Urgot ends Purge.
At maximum rank, Purge lasts indefinitely and becomes a toggled ability.
w1.notes:
* ''Purge'' uses {{tip|edge range}} for enemy targets only; Its range is ''center-to-edge''.
**'''Urgot's''' [[size]] increasing does not increase its range.
* The initial cast and the manual recast count as ability activations for the purposes of on-cast effects such as {{tip|Spellblade}} and stacking {{ai|Force Pulse|Kassadin}}.
** Before maximum rank, if ''Purge'' is not manually recasted, the effect will end without being considered as an ability activation.
* '''Urgot's''' facing direction during ''Purge'' is in the direction he's moving and not in the direction of his attack target.
* Before maximum rank, if continuously attacking without being interrupted or interrupting or canceling the cast, '''Urgot''' will attack 13 times.
* The bolts are considered basic attacks and thus apply {{sti|life steal|link=true}} at full efficiency.
* During ''Purge'', '''Urgot's''' {{sti|attack range|link=range}} is reduced by 200 and his attack commands instead issue movement commands to walk into the respective range of his target.
* {{tip|Slow resist}} does not modify flat reductions in movement speed.
* Percentage {{tip|slow|slows}} apply after the flat movement reduction.
* ''Purge's'' attacks do not interact with '''Urgot's''' {{tip|basic attack}} timer.
** After ending ''Purge'', he can usually attack again immediately.
* ''Purge'' does not fire while '''Urgot''' is unable to declare basic attacks (e.g. {{tip|crowd control}}, [[Channel#Casting Times|cast time]]).
**  If '''Urgot''' is {{tip|taunt|taunted}}, he will always fire at the source.
** ''Purge'' will fire while '''Urgot''' is {{tip|dash|dashing}} (e.g. while taking {{cai|Dark Passage|Thresh}}), with the exception of {{ais|Disdain|Urgot}} dash.
* Each shot counts as a separate hit for effects such as {{ri|Electrocute}}, {{iis|Muramana}} {{nie|Shock}}, and {{iis|Eclipse}} {{nie|Ever Rising Moon}}.
* ''Purge'' will apply {{ii|Runaan's Hurricane}} on every shot at 100% of the listed damage.
** On-hit damage applied by the bolts are still reduced by ''Purge''.
* The movement speed stat tooltip erroneously reads that the '''bonus''' movement speed is being reduced before '''base''' movement speed.{{bug|2}}

effects.str: • Modified Physical Damage: 12 (+ % AD)

e1.name: Disdain
description: After the cast time, '''Urgot''' {{tip|dash|dashes}} in the target direction, though not through terrain, dealing {{as|physical damage}} to all enemies within his path, {{tip|airborne|knocking them aside}}, and {{tip|stun|stunning}} them for 1 second.

'''Urgot''' comes to a stop upon colliding with an enemy champion, {{tip|stun|stunning}} them for {{fd|1.5}} seconds and, after {{fd|0.25}} seconds, also {{tip|airborne|flinging}} them to the location {{tt|100 units behind him|this destination is a fixed location and is unaffected by size modifiers on Urgot or the target moving away before the displacement started}}.
e1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Urgot shields himself for 4 seconds.
After the cast time, Urgot dashes in the target direction, though not through terrain, dealing physical damage to all enemies within his path, knocking them aside, and stunning them for 1 second.
Urgot comes to a stop upon colliding with an enemy champion, stunning them for 1.5 seconds and, after 0.25 seconds, also flinging them to the location 100 units behind him.
e1.notes:
* '''Urgot''' turns around when tossing an enemy over him, always facing his victim.
* The target will be {{tip|airborne|flinged}} to the location behind '''Urgot''' over {{fd|0.5}} seconds given that they do not move nor are moved from the position at which they collided with him while {{tip|stun|stunned}}.
* ''Disdain'' prevents {{ai|Purge|Urgot}} from firing for {{fd|1.25}} seconds.
* The range indicator length is 475 units, but the dash only moves '''Urgot''' 450 units.
* ''Disdain'' will cast from wherever '''Urgot''' is at the end of the cast time.
* The {{tip|shield}} is granted at the start of the cast time while the {{tip|dash}} begins after.
* The {{tip|airborne|fling}} will occur after {{fd|0.25}} seconds regardless of how far away the target is.
* {{tip|Displacement immunity}} will not resist the application of the {{tip|stun}}.

effects.str: • Shield Strength: (+ 150% bonus AD) (+ 15% bonus health)

r1.name: Fear Beyond Death
description: {{sbc|Active:}} '''Urgot''' fires a chem-drill in the target direction that impales the first enemy champion struck, dealing them {{as|physical damage}} and leashing them for 4 seconds, during which they're {{tip|sight|revealed}} and {{tip|slow|slowed}} by {{as|{{pp|type=target's '''missing''' health|key=%|0 to 75 for 11|key1=%|0 to 75|formula=1% per 1% missing health. ''This is capped at 75%''}}|health}}.

''Fear Beyond Death'' can be reactivated if the leashed target is below {{as|{{sti|health|25% of their '''maximum''' health}}}}, and does so automatically if the target would be killed by the damage from the chem-drill, the ability is cast again while the target was above the threshold and is then brought within it, or the target is within the threshold at the end of its duration.

{{sbc|Recast:}} '''Urgot''' launches chains at the leashed target, then {{tip|channel|channels}} for {{fd|1.5}} seconds once they latch on, reeling them towards him, {{tip|suppression|suppressing}} them, {{tip|true sight|revealing}} them, rendering them {{tip|untargetable}}, and preventing them from taking damage from {{tt|other sources|Negates application of damage from any source that is not the execution}}. If the target is near '''Urgot''' when the chains connect, they are pushed up to {{tt|1000|Estimated}} units away based on their proximity to him. This channel cannot be {{tip|interrupt|interrupted}} by {{tip|crowd control}}.

Upon completing the channel, the target is {{ccs|{{tip|execute|executed}}|true}}. If the execution is successful, all enemies near '''Urgot''' are made to {{tip|flee}} from him for {{fd|1.5}} seconds, during which they are {{tip|slow|slowed}} by 75%.
''Fear Beyond Death's recast can be used while affected by {{tip|cast-inhibiting crowd control}}. '''Urgot''' is {{tip|sight|revealed}} during Fear Beyond Death.''
r1.descriptionHtml:
Active: Urgot fires a chem-drill in the target direction that impales the first enemy champion struck, dealing them physical damage and leashing them for 4 seconds, during which they're revealed and slowed by 0 to 75 ‒ undefined.
Fear Beyond Death can be reactivated if the leashed target is below 25% of their maximum health, and does so automatically if the target would be killed by the damage from the chem-drill, the ability is cast again while the target was above the threshold and is then brought within it, or the target is within the threshold at the end of its duration.
Recast: Urgot launches chains at the leashed target, then channels for 1.5 seconds once they latch on, reeling them towards him, suppressing them, revealing them, rendering them untargetable, and preventing them from taking damage from other sources. If the target is near Urgot when the chains connect, they are pushed up to 1000 units away based on their proximity to him. This channel cannot be interrupted by crowd control.
Upon completing the channel, the target is executed true">Unknown value: ccs executed true. If the execution is successful, all enemies near Urgot are made to flee from him for 1.5 seconds, during which they are slowed by 75%.
Fear Beyond Death's recast can be used while affected by cast-inhibiting crowd control. Urgot is revealed during Fear Beyond Death.
r1.notes:
* Unlike most [[Projectile|missiles]], ''Fear Beyond Death'' '''can''' hit the edge of targets whose center is further than the missile range.
** However, it still cannot hit targets whose center is behind '''Urgot'''.
* Applies {{tip|spell damage}} on first cast and {{tip|raw damage}} on recast.
* The circular execution indicator is visible to '''Urgot''' only and appears on all enemy champions below the threshold if the ability is not on cooldown.
* The recast's name is ''Mercy''.
* ''Mercy's'' granted {{tip|untargetability}} does not {{tip|Homing projectile destruction|destroy}} in-flight {{tip|projectile|projectiles}} for the target.
* '''Urgot''' will place himself onto the ground and interrupts {{tip|airborne|displacements}} affecting him upon starting the channel.
** If the displacement effect is a ''knock up'' with no {{tip|debuff}} source, the ''airborne'' status is not removed and he spends significantly less time in the air.
* ''Fear Beyond Death'' will fire from wherever '''Urgot''' was at the start of the cast time.
* ''Fear Beyond Death'' prevents {{ai|Purge|Urgot}} from firing for {{fd|0.8}} seconds.
** The recast prevents {{ai|Purge|Urgot}} from firing for {{fd|1.5}} seconds.
* If '''Urgot''' is in [[Channel#Casting Times|cast time]] or is {{tip|dash|dashing}} while the chains are in transit, ''Mercy's'' forced movement will be deferred (the debuff will continuously refresh) until the cast or dash is complete. The target will still be ''untargetable'', prevented from taking damage from other sources, and ''suppressed'' during this time.
** If '''Urgot''' is {{tip|channel|channeling}} a spell, the channel is interrupted when the chains hit.
* Removing or resisting the {{tip|slow}} has no effect on the mark [[debuff]].
* The initial cast always counts as an ability activation for the purposes of on-cast effects such as {{tip|Spellblade}} and stacking {{ai|Force Pulse|Kassadin}}.
** If the ability hits a target who is below the threshold, it will automatically recast itself and it won't be considered as an ability activation.
** If the ability hits a target who is above the threshold and it's recasted early, the recast will happen automatically when they reach the threshold and it won't be considered as as ability activation.
** If the target got hit while above the threshold and it is recasted after they fall below it, the recast will be considered as an ability activation.
* Reactivating the ability early will reel the target as soon as they reach the {{as|25% '''maximum''' health}} threshold.
** The ability will reactivate and execute regardless of '''Urgot''' being affected by {{tip|crowd control}} or not, including self or enemy-imposed {{tip|stasis}}.
* There is a brief delay before the forced movement and untargetability begins.
* ''Fear Beyond Death'' can affect {{tip|clone|clones}}.
* '''Urgot''' cannot send out the chains if the target is {{tip|untargetable}}.
* The recast cannot be used (both manually and automatically) while '''Urgot''' is in {{tip|resurrection}}, attempting to manually do so puts it on a 5-second {{sti|cooldown}}.
** If the target is below the threshold at the end of the duration and '''Urgot''' is revived, the recast will initiate regardless of the cooldown.
* The recast's chains are classified as a {{tip|projectile}} and they will fail to affect their target if:
** '''Urgot''' or his target {{tip|death|dies}} or enters {{tip|resurrection}}.
** The target becomes {{tip|untargetable}}, even if the granted source does not {{tip|homing projectile destruction|destroy}} in-flight projectiles.
** They collide with {{ai|Wind Wall|Yasuo}} or {{ai|Unbreakable|Braum}}.
*** If {{ai|Unbreakable|Braum}} intercepts the chains and {{ci|Braum}} is not the target, they're destroyed.
*** If {{ci|Braum}} is the target, he will still be reeled in and executed as normal.
** The target is {{tip|cc-immune|crowd control immune}} when the chains hit.
** The target is {{tip|zombie state|a zombie}}.
* {{tip|spell shield|Spell shield}} will '''not''' block the recast's chains.
* Removing the {{tip|suppression}} (e.g. by {{tip|cleanse|cleanses}} or '''Urgot's''' death) during the reel-in will prevent the {{tip|execute}} and stop the forced movement from being renewed, but the most recent one will still be present and move the victim to '''Urgot's''' previous location. The granted ''untargetability'' and prevention of damage to other sources is also lost in the process.
* {{tip|Displacement immunity}}, while preventing being dragged, does not remove the {{tip|suppression}}, which can last for longer than the usual execution time. Once the target inevitably loses their ''displacement immunity'', they are executed within {{fd|1.5}} seconds. The target is ''untargetable'' and prevented from taking damage from other sources for the whole duration of the ''suppression'', even while ''displacement immune''.
* When the chains start reeling in and suppressing a [[Summoner|player's]] champion, chains will also cover the sides of their screen.
* The target champion shrinks in [[size]] in several steps after reaching '''Urgot's''' grinder and before being executed.
** If the ''suppression'' ends in any way, the target returns to their normal size.
** If the execution is successful, the victim's corpse will be effectively invisible unless they enter a {{tip|zombie state}}.
* The target will die regardless of their {{as|'''current''' health}} once the recast's chains hit, even if they are {{tip|heal|healed}}.
** If the target has {{tip|invulnerability}} that persists the duration of the channel, it will protect them from the execution.
*** {{ai|Undying Rage|Tryndamere}} will prevent {{ci|Tryndamere}} from dying by the execute. The execute will bypass his minimum health threshold though and reduce him to {{as|1 health}} in this case.
*** The effect will also not prevent the activation of {{tip|resurrection}} effects, such as {{ii|Guardian Angel}} or {{cai|Rebirth|Anivia}}.
*** [[Death#Post-death_events|Post-death events]] such as {{tip|zombie state|Zombie State}} effects (e.g, {{cai|Death Defied|Karthus}}, {{cai|Icathian Surprise|Kog'Maw}}, and {{cai|Glory in Death|Sion}}) will be triggered.
*** Only the target's {{as|'''current''' health}} will count as '''Urgot's''' damage in post-game statistics and {{sti|spell vamp|link=true}} healing.
* ''Fear Beyond Death's'' initial cast will not perform the automatic recast from dealing enough damage to kill {{ci|Sion}}.
* ''Fear Beyond Death's'' recast will be placed on a 5-second {{sti|cooldown}} if the target is below the threshold and becomes targetable again after completing the dash from {{ai|Hero's Entrance|Galio}}.
* The following table refers for interactions while '''Urgot''' is {{tip|channel|channeling}}:
{{ct|channel|attack=false|cast=false|move=true|items=false, true|spells=true, true, false|interrupts=death}}
